project_abstract.cdata: The objective of the Railways Reform Project for Macedonia, former Yugoslav Republic of will improve the financial viability, productivity, and effectiveness of railway operations. The extension is necessary to allow: (i) delivery to the Macedonian railways transport Joint Stock Company (JSC)-Skopje of the 25 flat bed wagons being supplied by the company Gredelj prior to project closing and the full disbursement of funds. The wagons are currently under construction but complete delivery and acceptance is not possible before the current closing dates of the loans. The Borrower has in place an action plan to ensure delivery within the proposed closing dates and this is being monitored by a Ministerial Committee comprising members from the Ministry of Transport and Communication, the railway company and an independent expert; and (ii) carrying out of the second set of measurements needed for the calibration of the railway information management system being installed for the Public Enterprise (PE) Macedonian railways infrastructure-Skopje. The first set of measurements are about to be completed and a six month gap is required between the first and second measurements for technical reasons. The Borrower has in place an action plan to ensure that the second measurements, over a two week period, takes place by mid-March, 2011. This will be the second extension of the initially agreed project closing date of October, 2009.
